intro: Carmichaelia robusta, commonly known as the robust shieldflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Carmichaelia robusta is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in the ecological systems of its native environment.
